etymology.description: ⾠(艸) (cǎo, "grass") + 日(日) (rì, "sun") + 屯(屯) (zhūn, "sprout") = sun shining on grass with sprouts -> spring
etymology.interpretation: The character 春(春) (chūn, "spring") involves elements representing natural growth and revival: grass, sun, and sprouts together illustrate the vibrant growth occurring in springtime.

examples.chinese: 春天来了(春天來了)，万物复苏(萬物復蘇)。
examples.english: Spring has arrived, and all things are reviving.

examples.chinese: 春光明媚(春光明媚)，人们心情愉快(人們心情愉快)。
examples.english: The spring light is bright, and people feel joyful.
